topics.body: Support for gay marriage in the usa may have surpassed 60%.  The poll I'm reading isn't a super cereal one; gallup still needs to do one as there hasn't been one in two months, but basically in May 56% of americans support legalizing gay marriage, but now it seems to have ticked either close to or passed the 60% mark.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d556af63687243f03a0000#post_53d556af63687243f03a0000

topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d556e7636872243d780000#post_53d556e7636872243d780000
The reason why this is good when you think about it once it hits the 66% mark the anti-glbt movement will not have enough popular support left to maintain itself.  The number of people who oppose gay marriage is already below a third, but once support for gay marriage hits 66% g fucking g.
